alert.note: Alert for Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 7:34AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN TUOLUMNE COUNTY THROUGH 815 AM PDT... At 733 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Yosemite Valley, or 25 miles southwest of Twin Lakes, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Eleanor Ranger Station, Hetch Hetchy, Hetch Hetchy Ranger Station, Miguel Meadow Ranger Station, Mather Ranger Station, and Rancheria Falls Wilderness Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Yosemite NP outside of the valley
